p: Saponins have been credited with a number of pharmacological properties. However, the important ones include permeabilizing of the cell membrane (Hostettmann and Marston, 1995 ▶), lowering serum cholesterol levels (Francis et al., 2002 ▶), stimulation of luteinizing hormone release leading to abortifacient properties (Francis et al., 2002 ▶), immunomodulatory potential via cytokine interplay (Sun et al., 2009 ▶), cytostatic and cytotoxic effects on malignant tumor cells (Bachran et al., 2008 ▶), adjuvant properties for vaccines as immune-stimulatory complexes (Sjolander et al., 1998 ▶), and synergistic enhancement of the toxicity of immunotoxins (Heisler et al., 2005 ▶).
